<ce:figure id="f0010">
<ce:label>Fig. 1</ce:label>
<ce:caption id="ca0015">
<ce:simple-para id="sp0055" view="all">The {[(VO<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>(L<ce:inf loc="post">1</ce:inf>H<ce:inf loc="post">−<ce:hsp sp="0.10"></ce:hsp>1</ce:inf>)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>]Na<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>(CH<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>OH)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>} repeating unit in the structure of <ce:bold>1</ce:bold>. Symmetry operations: (′) 2<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>−<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>x, 2<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>−<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>y, −<ce:hsp sp="0.10"></ce:hsp>z; (″) 2.5<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>−<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>x, 0.5<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>+<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>y, 0.5<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>−<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>z; (‴) 2.5<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>−<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>x, −<ce:hsp sp="0.10"></ce:hsp>0.5<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>+<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>y, 0.5<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>−<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>z. Color code: V: green; Na, yellow; O, red; N, blue; C, gray; H, purple.</ce:simple-para>
</ce:caption>
<ce:link id="lk0005" locator="gr1"></ce:link>
</ce:figure>
cln_elements.clean_text: Fig. 1  The {[(VO2)2(L1H-1)2]Na2(CH3OH)2} repeating unit in the structure of 1. Symmetry operations: (') 2-x, 2-y, -z; (") 2.5-x, 0.5+y, 0.5-z; (‴) 2.5-x, -0.5+y, 0.5-z. Color code: V: green; Na, yellow; O, red; N, blue; C, gray; H, purple.

<ce:figure id="f0040">
<ce:label>Fig. 7</ce:label>
<ce:caption id="ca0045">
<ce:simple-para id="sp0085" view="all">A. Percent change of cell survival in 3T3-L1 pre-adipocytes, following treatment with various concentrations (1–200<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>μΜ) of KVO<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf> for 24<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>h. Sodium deoxycholate was used as a positive control. Values represent the mean value of three independent experiments. Vertical bars represent SEMs. B. Percent change of cell survival in 3T3-L1 pre-adipocytes following treatment with various concentrations (1–200<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>μΜ) of L<ce:inf loc="post">1</ce:inf>H (B-1), L<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>H (B-2) or L<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>H (B-3) for 24<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>h. Sodium deoxycholate has been used as a positive control. Values represent the mean value of several (no less than triplicate) different experiments. Vertical bars represent standard deviation. *p<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp><<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>0.05 vs. control.</ce:simple-para>
</ce:caption>
<ce:link id="lk0035" locator="gr7"></ce:link>
</ce:figure>
cln_elements.clean_text: Fig. 7  A. Percent change of cell survival in 3T3-L1 pre-adipocytes, following treatment with various concentrations (1-200μΜ) of KVO3 for 24h. Sodium deoxycholate was used as a positive control. Values represent the mean value of three independent experiments. Vertical bars represent SEMs. B. Percent change of cell survival in 3T3-L1 pre-adipocytes following treatment with various concentrations (1-200μΜ) of L1H (B-1), L2H (B-2) or L3H (B-3) for 24h. Sodium deoxycholate has been used as a positive control. Values represent the mean value of several (no less than triplicate) different experiments. Vertical bars represent standard deviation. *p<0.05 vs. control.

cln_elements.content:
<ce:figure id="sch0005">
<ce:label>Scheme 1</ce:label>
<ce:caption id="ca0075">
<ce:simple-para id="sp0125" view="all">Schematic representation of the ligands (L<ce:inf loc="post">1</ce:inf>H, L<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>H, L<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>H) used in this study. The hydrogen in the adopted formulation signifies the presence of the phenolic hydrogen. The additional hydrogen originating in the alcoholic moieties of the ligands and removed upon deprotonation is dubbed H<ce:inf loc="post">−<ce:hsp sp="0.10"></ce:hsp>1</ce:inf>, thereby leading to [L<ce:inf loc="post">i</ce:inf>H<ce:inf loc="post">−<ce:hsp sp="0.10"></ce:hsp>1</ce:inf>]<ce:sup loc="post">2<ce:hsp sp="0.10"></ce:hsp>−</ce:sup> (i<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>=<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>1–3) ions in the emerging vanadium complex assemblies.</ce:simple-para>
</ce:caption>
<ce:link id="lk0065" locator="sc1"></ce:link>
</ce:figure>
cln_elements.clean_text: Scheme 1  Schematic representation of the ligands (L1H, L2H, L3H) used in this study. The hydrogen in the adopted formulation signifies the presence of the phenolic hydrogen. The additional hydrogen originating in the alcoholic moieties of the ligands and removed upon deprotonation is dubbed H-1, thereby leading to [LiH-1]2- (i=1-3) ions in the emerging vanadium complex assemblies.
